text: Dr. Norman Henry Tolk (born January 9, 1938) is an American physicist and musician. == Life == Tolk was born in Idaho Falls, Idaho. He grew up in a Mormon and Protestant family. He majored in physics at Harvard College, graduating in 1960, and earned his Ph.D. in atomic physics from Columbia University in 1966. Currently he is a Professor of Physics and Astronomy at Vanderbilt University. For all his life Tolk has been a Mormon. == Physics == Ever since second grade, Tolk wanted to become a physicist. After earning his degrees at Columbia and Harvard, he worked at AT&T; Bell Laboratories in New Jersey. He brought the Free-electron laser to Vanderbilt.
